history.content:
Hi everyone!

To wrap up our Master’s capstone project (which is advised by Prof. Alvin Cheung), we are conducting an IRB-approved user study that seeks to observe student-TA interactions when solving SQL problems with/without the Cosette SQL Equivalence Checker tool.

We are hoping to recruit two sets of participants:

  1. Students who have little/no SQL background
  2. Past or current student instructors for SQL-related courses such as Data 100 or CS 186

Study sessions will be approximately 1 hour long and take place in-person on the UC Berkeley campus (times + locations TBD). Participation is completely voluntary, and participants will be compensated with a $50 Amazon gift card.

If interested, please fill out this google form and one of our researchers will reach out to you by email.

Thank you!
history.subject: Cosette User Study
